title: Amount spent on smartphone accessories by U.S. consumers 2010
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Responses on X-axis for 4 groups Under $50, $50 - $100, $100 - $200, and $200 and up. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Response Android owners had the maximum Share of respondents among all 4 groups, and it was for Under $50. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Response BlackBerry owners for $200 and up.
There is a gap of 8.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for $200 and up in Response iPhone owners and BlackBerry owners.
Averaging all 4 groups Under $50, $50 - $100, $100 - $200, and $200 and up, the Response BlackBerry owners is the maximum Share of respondents and Android owners is the minimum Share of respondents.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 3 different Responses for 4 groups Under $50, $50 - $100, $100 - $200, and $200 and up that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 4 groups, Under $50 had the highest Share of respondents for Response Android owners and $200 and up had the lowest Share of respondents for Response BlackBerry owners.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Responses on X-axis for 4 groups Under $50, $50 - $100, $100 - $200, and $200 and up. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Response Android owners had the maximum Share of respondents among all 4 groups, and it was for Under $50. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Response BlackBerry owners for $200 and up.
There is a gap of 8.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for $200 and up in Response iPhone owners and BlackBerry owners.
Averaging all 4 groups Under $50, $50 - $100, $100 - $200, and $200 and up, the Response BlackBerry owners is the maximum Share of respondents and Android owners is the minimum Share of respondents.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 3 different Responses for 4 groups Under $50, $50 - $100, $100 - $200, and $200 and up that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 4 groups, Under $50 had the highest Share of respondents for Response Android owners and $200 and up had the lowest Share of respondents for Response BlackBerry owners.
For Response iPhone owners, $200 and up had the maximum Share of respondents and it saw the lowest in Response BlackBerry owners out of all 3 Responses.
The maximum Share of respondents for $200 and up that was found in Response iPhone owners was 9.0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Response BlackBerry owners.
Among all 4 groups, Under $50 had the gap of 27.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents observed in Response Android owners and iPhone owners respectively.

Under $50 had the maximum Share of respondents out of all 4 groups in Response Android owners followed by Under $50 in Android owners, and the minimum Share of respondents is found for $200 and up in BlackBerry owners.
Averaging all 4 groups Under $50, $50 - $100, $100 - $200, and $200 and up, the Response BlackBerry owners is the maximum Share of respondents and Android owners is the minimum Share of respondents.
